name: Fish House Punch
description: This was first made in the 18th century at the Fish House Club on the Schuylkill River, near Philadelphia. The recipe is from Harriet Lembeck’s revision of “Grossman's Guide to Wines, Beers, and Spirits.” She got it from the “Philadelphia Cook Book of Town and Country.”
recipeIngredient: 1 to 2 quarts water (not from the Schuylkill)

recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve the sugar in the water in a punch bowl. Add the lemon juice, then the other ingredients. Add a four-pound block of ice to the bowl and let it melt for two hours. This makes up to two gallons if you can wait until all the ice has melted.
